verses.kjv: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
verses.ct: Wisdom has built her house and carved out its 7 pillars.

verses.kjv: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
verses.ct: She has prepared her meat, mixed her wine, and set her table.

verses.kjv: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,
verses.ct: She has sent out her servant girls, and she calls out from the highest points of the city,

verses.kjv: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
verses.ct: "Whoever is inexperienced, come in here!" To anyone who lacks understanding, she says,

verses.kjv: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
verses.ct: "Come, eat my food and drink the wine I have mixed.

verses.kjv: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
verses.ct: Leave your foolish ways behind and truly live — walk on the path of understanding."

verses.kjv: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
verses.ct: Anyone who corrects a mocker only earns insults, and whoever confronts a wicked person gets hurt in return.

verses.kjv: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
verses.ct: Don't correct a mocker, or he will hate you. Correct a wise person, and he will love you for it.

verses.kjv: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
verses.ct: Teach a wise person, and he will become even wiser. Instruct a righteous person, and he will grow in learning.

verses.kjv: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
verses.ct: Wholehearted dedication to the LORD is the starting point of wisdom, and knowing the Holy One is true understanding.

verses.kjv: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
verses.ct: Through me your days will be multiplied, and years will be added to your life.

verses.kjv: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
verses.ct: If you are wise, you yourself benefit from it. If you mock, you alone will suffer the consequences.

verses.kjv: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
verses.ct: The woman named Folly is loud and brash — she is ignorant and knows nothing.

verses.kjv: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
verses.ct: She sits at the doorway of her house, on a chair at the highest points of the city,

verses.kjv: To call passengers who go right on their ways:
verses.ct: calling out to people passing by who are minding their own business:

verses.kjv: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
verses.ct: "Whoever is inexperienced, come in here!" To anyone who lacks understanding, she says,

verses.kjv: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
verses.ct: "Stolen water tastes sweet, and food eaten in secret is delicious."

verses.kjv: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
verses.ct: But what he doesn't realize is that the dead are already there — that her guests have sunk into the depths of the grave.
